com:
Welcome to the Pony Voice Preservation Project!
youtu.be/730zGRwbQuE

The Pony Preservation Project is a collaborative effort by /mlp/ to build and curate pony datasets for as many applications in AI as possible.

Technology has progressed such that a trained neural network can generate convincing voice clips, drawings and text for any person or character using existing audio recordings, artwork and fanfics as a reference. As you can surely imagine, AI pony voices, drawings and text have endless applications for pony content creation.

AI is incredibly versatile, basically anything that can be boiled down to a simple dataset can be used for training to create more of it. AI-generated images, fanfics, wAIfu chatbots and even animation are possible, and are being worked on here.

Any anon is free to join, and there are many active tasks that would suit any level of technical expertise. If you’re interested in helping out, take a look at the quick start guide linked below and ask in the thread for any further detail you need.

EQG and G5 are not welcome.

derpy.me/FDnSk

name: QM
com:
>Space.... may be the final frontier, but it also sure as fuck is the most boring one
>It might have been something very special a millenia ago, back when the first pony left Equestria
>But as you drift through the endless void inside of your tin can you can't help but be bored beyond belief
>Out here you don't even get access to any of the station radios to take your mind off of the inky blackness
>And while you'd love to say that you could have just played some music you loaded onto your ship's board computer...
>The entire ship goes dark as if it knew what you were thinking about, the humming power core silencing itself
>You groan in annoyance and unbuckle yourself as you gently begin floating upwards in the lack of gravity
>Not that this piece of space junk has any gravity anyways, even with the reactor online
>Using one of your hooves to hold yourself to your captain's chair you align yourself carefully to the door at the back
>A gentle push propels you forward, carrying your lithe form through the cabin before seconds later you touch opposite end
>Taking holf of one of the many pipes moving along the wall you pull yourself to the airlock carefully and press the button next to it
>Frowning, you glare at the stubborn door and the fact that the emergency power decided to crap out on you as well
>In frustration you decide it is a great idea to kick the door, just to realize that every action has an equal reaction and in space there is nothing to stop you
>Going for a backwards tumble you flail your helpless hooves and even try flapping your wings to no avail
>No air and no gravity means your feathery (albeit covered by your flight suit) appendages are basically useless anyways
>Slamming head first into the console you attempt to rub your snout before remembering that, yeah, you have a helmet on and for good reason
>Sadly, while slamming onto your controls usually seems to work wonders, your little crash has done nothing but... broken off a small switch that now floats between your eyes
"Great, absolutely fucking amazing", you shout as you slam down a hoof on the console, immediately regretting it
>This time you were wise to hold yourself against one of the bars mounted to the console so you don't get thrown away, but now your hoof is hurting like a bitch
>Cursing, you turn back around and push yourself off again, much less graceful this time as your irritation gets the better of you
>Holding on to the wheel that serves as an override to the airlock's door, you begin to turn it with all the might that your quite frankly not exactly trained muscles can muster
>In absolute silence you struggle but eventually the probably rusted wheel begins to turn and the door slowly slides open
>Squeezing through the small gap you've managed to create you struggle a bit as your hindquarters decide to hinder your progress for just a few seconds

com:
What, you didn't think Into the Blue was the only CYOA I was running, did you?


>who's this faggot again?
I'm a QM that used to have a lot more spare time. Then 2020 happened and my life went to Hell, so I decided to put this CYOA on hold for awhile. It's been that way for a LOT longer than I ever intended for it to. I'm sorry for that; I'm sure most of you who played this back in its heyday (~2019 or so) are long gone... But that's alright. That's how life goes sometimes. There's no sense crying about the past, so let's move on. I'm back, and I'd like to continue this CYOA, with whoever's left and whoever is yet to come. So, if you'd like to play, come on in!

>okay faggot so how does THIS game work?
Unlike Into the Blue, this game is a lot more story-focused. You play as a unicorn colt named Tough Cookie, a comic and action show fan who's getting the chance of a lifetime: to be a REAL superhero. It's up to you to guide him in his quest to protect his friends and family, his hometown, and his world.

Since anonpone.com seems to be broken right now, here's a more direct link to the previous threads:

"Deploying eye protection!" Jar quickly says.
Your visor darkens to a nearly black color, a split-second before it's lit back up again by what you'd guess from how bright it is to be THE SUN. You instinctively squeeze your eyes shut, then suddenly find yourself falling back to the floor.
"Umph!"
"AAAAAAAAAAAGH!!!!" Drejj screams. "MY FUCKING EYES!!!"
Not wanting to join Drejj in being blind, you very carefully crack an eye open. There's some spots in your eyes, but the lighthouse-tier flash you produced is rapidly disappearing, like the lightbulb of a camera going back out after the flash. You scramble to your hooves.
>"It worked!"
Hearing your voice, Drejj lurches forward and swats at the air. "I CAN'T SEE!!! WHAT HAPPENED?! WHAT DID YOU DO?!?"
Though your heart is pounding, you can't help but grin.
>"Do you want me to show ya?"
Drejj roars furiously, stomping unsteadily towards you. He doesn't quite get it right, though. "MORE KNIVES!!" he yells. "DEPLOY MORE KNIVES, DAMN IT!!"
Like a magic beanstalk, another cluster of spikes bursts out of the ground a few feet to your left. A second shoots up to your right, and a third pops out of the floor not far from the first one.
>"Hey, they're all missing..."
"I see now." Jar says, sounding like he's just figured out the answer to a mystery he's been thinking about for awhile. "The Field of Knives isn't remote-operated. Drejj must be controlling it via psychospheric conduit."
>"...Mean-"
"Meaning he is controlling it with his mind." Jar explains. "If he can't find us, neither can it."
>"Awesome! Now's our chance!"

You don’t have time to react properly to the sudden attack. Before you can muster a Countergrowth, a ray of green light hits you and Pear Plum strait in the head. You feel dizziness overcoming you, and an unspeakable weariness taking hold of your being.

You can only see Pear Plum collapse before falling yourself into a deep slumber.


>You are Silver Willow.

Peeking from Little Spoon’s pocket, you desperately look for a way to help your friends out of this sticky situation.

Minutes ago, you were hearing Little Spoon and Pear Plum talk with this forest mare, and suddenly she cast a spell on your friends. Fortunately, you believe it has only put them to sleep.
Still, you’re far from being out of danger. Using her magic, the hag has carried you all into what is probably her dwelling in the forest.

You’ve remained hidden so far, but it’s been a while you didn’t hear the pet raven of the old mare and can finally attempt a peek outside the bard’s pocket.

You’re inside a hut made of wood mostly. Both Little Spoon and Pear Plum are on the floor, frozen in a magic coma. The hag wasn’t gentle as she transported you, and yet they remained fast asleep. You’re afraid you won’t be able to wake them up by normal means.
Right now, you captor is facing away from you. She has emptied your friend’s bags on her bedding and is focussed on examining their contents. You don’t see her bird anywhere right now, so this might be the chance for this 3-inches mare to attempt something.

Though, as much as being little helped you not being seen, you’re not feeling very safe right now. You have your rapier, but it’s a mere sewing needle to the old hag that looks colossal in comparison. At least, you’ve noticed that being little has a few perks. You body feels lighter, and even climbing vertical surfaces doesn’t demand much efforts from you.

Around you, you see the bodies of your two friends of the floor. The hut is rather small, and only has one room. There’s the space where the old mare probably sleeps, where she’s looking through the stuff of your friends at the moment. To her left, there’s the door that leads outside. To her right, there’s a stove and cauldron with a hearth made of mismatched bricks under it.

Finally, behind the hag is a workbench with many shelves over it that climb up to the ceiling. They’re all overflowing with books, vials containing brews of atypical colours, and many jars containing what look like magical ingredients. There’s also herbs, bones and pelts of small animal hanging from the ceiling.

The room is dimly lit by the witch’s lanterns she hung above her, and a few other candles here and there. The hag mumbles to herself as she examines the stuff.

last_replies.com:
>You slowly make your way up yet another hill.
>Fatigue is setting in, but you can’t rest yet.
“Just… A little more…”
>You finally manage to make it to the top of your grassy foe and flop onto the ground with a huff.
“Friggin… hill… ugh…”
>After laying on the cool grass for a while, you sit up and soak in the scenery.
>The landscape was bumpy given all the hills, but in the middle of all of it, you see a sleepy little town.
>Your next stop.
>Heh, ‘sleepy town’ indeed! Everyone’s probably tired from dealing with all these dumb hills!
>It reminds you of home, which isn’t helping your already intense homesickness.
>Nothing you can do about that, Rem! Just… Don’t think about it.
>Easier said than done, but you'll manage.
>You pull off your guitar and satchel and set them next to you.
>Maybe you’ll be able to get a proper strap in town, seeing as your current one is starting to fray.
>You didn’t know they could do that!
>A quick glance inside the ol’ bag tells you you're pretty much at your limit, not a morsel in sight and not a dime to your name, which puts a wrench in your plan for a new guitar strap.
>Grass it is! Lots of it around here anyway, so you doubt you’ll go hungry.
>The perks of being a pony, you’d say!
“But Remmy! Ain’t that… Uncivilized?”
“Uncivilized? Bah! All's fair in survival, babe!”
>Huh.
>You might be getting a *bit* loopy.
>When was the last time you talked to someone?
>You shake your head, getting yourself in a more ‘normal’ state of mind.
>How about a little practice? That’ll help, not like lunch will be going anywhere, right?
>You slide your guitar from its place in the grass and ready it.
>You lightly strum down on the strings, which ring out a little ‘pang’.
>But what to play?
>You play a few chords for nothing in particular while you think.
>How about…
>Yeah, that’ll make you feel better.
>You take a deep breath.
“Hearing the frogs chirp…”
>And start playing.
>...
>You're scared.
>But...
>It’ll be okay.
>New starts are always scary.
>But you...
>You’re strong!
>Mom said so.
>And with her old guitar, it's...
>I-it's...
>It's like she's still here with you.

Realized a little too late that I probably should of tried making Remedy and the guitar fit in with everything else, but I guess it could be worse. Speaking of the guitar, it's still funky looking, despite having an actual guitar I could have used for reference, I didn't for some unknown reason. Next time will be different! (Hopefully) I got to remember to give Rem an eye color, so that's on the to-do list. Glad I finally got something for Remedy written. Always nice too have a starting point set up.

>What is Flutterrape?
Flutterrape is a collection of stories about ponies trying and failing to have sex with Anon, the only human in Equestria. While the title implies that it is Fluttershy trying to rape Anon, others may follow in her stead and attempt their own versions of rape. There are different versions of Flutterrape, but most are light-hearted comedies about the ponies failing in their attempts to get into Anon’s pants. Just because your story has Anon in it, doesn't mean it fits in this thread. Check other threads (AiE, RGRE etc) about story content before posting.

>It's been 10 years, how is this thread still alive?
A perverse mixture of necromancy and spite.

>How do I start writing?
Use your imagination, you nitwit. Additionally, brush up on your grammar and abandon your standards.

So many threads have died, but only Flutterrape has remained. We shall always remain. We are bound to the fate of the board as a lich is bound to its phylactery.

sub: /FoE/ - Fallout Equestria: A Post Apocalyptic Pony Thread
com:
Wasteland carols edition

Fallout Equestria, a story that bleeds two franchises together to build something magical. On one side, you have death, destruction, decay, and misery - on the other, you have ponies. Doesn't sound like it should mix? You'd be surprised. When the world around you is wasteland, all you're left with is hope, and as we all know, ponies can do spectacular things with just a little hope.
Previous thread: >>39186895

Read Fallout Equestria by Kkat to appreciate the setting that many writers have then lent upon after being so captivated by the wonders.
The original story which spawned its own fandom can be found here: http://www.fimfiction.net/story/119190/

These next four stories comprise the rest of what is considered "the big 5", alongside the original. They were biggest hitters early in the fandom, be it for having started before many others, their length, or overall quality.

Project Horizons:
https://www.fimfiction.net/story/208056/

Pink Eyes:
https://www.fimfiction.net/story/931/

Murky Number Seven:
https://www.fimfiction.net/story/47300/

Heroes:
https://www.fimfiction.net/story/662/

Though, a reminder; just because these are the most well known, that isn't to say that there aren't other stories out there! There are many hidden gems that simply don't get the love they deserve purely because people don't give them the chance. Why not open your heart and try to find a new favorite? Anons are absolutely welcomed and encouraged to return with fic discussion of even the most obscure fics!

>Fan games:
Fallout Equestria: Remains is a Fallout Equestria Roguelike. It is the best thing to come of the fandom recently. Seriously go play it https://foe-remains.gitlab.io/main_en.html

Balefire Blues is a Hearts of Iron IV mod. In it you take control over various FoE factions seeking to conquer the wasteland. steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2307988796

Ashes Town is a derivative of Pony Town in the Fallout Equestria universe.

The long story short is as follows:
In the aftermath of the utter shitshow known as last years "Town Hall" mod sticky event, EQG spam hit an all time high, and there were several individuals who spent each day shitting up pony threads with offtopic spam and trolling. This went on for a few months, until things reached a breaking point where several anons started collaborating together in the Fan Site Alternative Threads about creating a new pony board, since it seemed like nothing was ever going to be done about the problems plaguing /mlp/.
You can check out the threads on desuarchive from March through about June/July to back this up, if you're curious.

Not long after that, NHNB(No Hooves? No Business) launched as an EQG/humanized-free pony board, owned and operated by /mlp/ anons, to be a reliable place to post in case things never got better, or Hiro/glowies/some other power decided to ever nuke the board. As >>39395180 pointed out, it's not meant to replace or compete with /mlp/.
That's why it gets called a bunker or "The Last Stand" on the map. Because besides /mlpol/ or /pone/, what else is there? Groomercord? Reddit?

Currently, the people making use of it the most are rangebanned anons who refuse to buy a 4chan pass, along with a few regular generals who have backup threads on there to post between the downtime of threads here on /mlp/.

Coincidentally, shortly after NHNB launched some of the EQG trolls finally started getting their posts deleted or outright banned. I wonder why...

~~~~~

>So, wait, why am Ah' a princess again?

>Because you seem to be the only goddamn one of those ponies who gets that a Princess need to do actual work regarding maintenance of the kingdom. You know how much city planning or trade negotiations Twilight or Luna have done? Fucking nothing. Everyone is obsessed with the world ending threats they think I should fight, but the minute I point out the free health care I have to work to maintain everyone goes quiet. And don't even get me started on Cadence, who can't even manage a basic meeting with the Equestrian Games representative. Fucking annoying. Go do actual princess stuff, because apparently everyone else got the pamphlets mixed up or something and thinks "Princess" means "Beat cop."

~~~~~

Are you feeling creative? Try your hand at writing a story! No contribution is too small and we love having new folks around.

If you're more artistically inclined give a drawing or sketch a shot. Don't fret too much; it doesn't have to be fancy and we appreciate artwork a lot.

If that isn't your style either, writers always need feedback. So tell us what you liked - and what you didn't - to help us improve.

If you are unsure about anything, do not be afraid to ask. We will gladly bring you up-to-date or explain anything you feel is unclear.

I know this is late as hell, but for those in the future reading through this and are confused, there are two definitions of "seasons". There are astrological seasons, where winter begins on the 21st, and meteorological seasons, where winter starts on the 1st. The former is based just hard on the position of the Earth relative to the sun, and the latter is based on essentially just three-month blocks as decided by climatologists. The first obviously has the advantage of a hard physical reference point, but again the second makes stuff like seasonal statistics, certain commerce logistics, etc. easier due to being more consistent so they each have their own uses.

Source: https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/news/meteorological-versus-astronomical-seasons

>>They made a feeble attempt at making a new character for Twilight even though the rest of her design was recycled
The design was recycled because it was supposed to be the alt universe version of the same character, not sure what the issue is there. I liked how they made Twilight act differently from pony Twilight, it was really nice to have different take on Twilight who was more curious, more analytical, more shy/socially awkward, less assertive, and less by the book/ overly cautious. I wish they managed to make the other humans more distinctive in personality compared to the ponies, the rest just came off as either the same or somewhat flanderized. There were minor differences (human Applejack seems more laid back, human Fluttershy a bit more rebellious, more outgoing) but nothing major like with Twilight.

>It was a bunch of "high-schoolers" riding dirt bikes while people fall into a bottomless void. It made no sense at all
Canterlot High School was already used to and accepting of the magic due to the events of the first 2 movies. And the Crystal Prep side knew of the magic and was unhappy with it, which is why they had Twilight release her magic to fight back. The magic issue was acknowledged by both sides. Is it a bit unbelievable that high schools would play with dangerous magic like this? Sure, but I don't find it to go beyond the reasonable suspension of disbelief that is needed to tell fantasy stories like this. Just compare it to Harry Potter where the school stayed open in spite of the magic actually leading to several deaths.

>>It seemed cool
Yes, I found the climax to be really fun and well done. It was suspenseful, I was invested in Twilight's struggle, her demon design was really cool, the Unleash the Magic song was fantastic, and it was great to see Sunset having developed as a character to the point where she managed to help Twilight while in that form. I found it to be an all around great climax.

>Twilight's character consisted of "I want to find out about magic but I'm not going to communicate properly because I have autism or something"
She did not communicate it with the mane cast because she barely knew them. Why would a girl who is already shy want to tell strangers about some dangerous magic she was trying to find, especially with how weird their behavior toward her was from her perspective?

>>It was enjoyable seeing them hang out
How this not a valid factor in liking something in MLP? The strength of MLP has always been seeing the great charming interactions between the characters, and I found Friendship Games to feature plenty of that enjoyable character interaction.
